name: Quality Hotel St. Catherine

reviews.title: Good Quality in Bordeaux
reviews.text: Quality Hotel St Catherine Bordeaux

likes.disliked: — Should have gone out for breakfast at least once

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in September.Booked it on the Web for 120 Euros pn. It fitted our criteria of A/C, fridge, non smoking and a safe in the room.
reviews.title: Always unpredictable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening by train and took a cab, we knew about the ‘pedestrian mall’ but also that cab drivers can get in by using their card to disable road blockers. Which ours did.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we left we walked through Parliament square to the tram stop to go back to station. Be warned you cannot buy tickets there; it doesn’t even look like a stop. You must have your ticket already.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.text: The hotel was great, level entry but about 8 steps down to the reception desk and lift. (I was getting very sick of carrying bags by now-this was a long trip and mostly by train)
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a let down! Where this hotel gets its three stars from I have no idea! The room was very basic and uninspiring, the bathroom floor was very unattractive lino,the drains smelled everytime you turned the water on,the air con was noisy,you couldn't see out of the window unless you stood on a chair and the bed was the smallest double in the world...need I go on?!?!The only positive is the central location. Glad I booked through Laterooms and didn't pay full price.
reviews.title: Never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room, large, airy and quiet. Furnishings a bit tired, could use a new bedspread, curtains and fresh paint. Bathroom, clean and adequete. Breakfast buffet, uninspiring. Good location for dining, sightseeing, shopping and tram. Parking for car a bit of hike. Reception was good.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited this hotel last week for a five day stay, largely down to TA reviews (we'd previously had success doing this with the NH Budapest).
reviews.title: Not impressed at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seriously disappointed. Despite having called the week before and been promised one of the street view rooms, we opened the door to find that we were overlooking a wall four feet away. The carpet was dirty, the shower didn't fit into the wall mount and the whole room was tatty and dark. It was on the first floor, so in the morning we awoke to the sound of clattering breakfast plates and the smell of greasy bacon through the aircon.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Changed rooms to the second floor, with a promised street view.....but the room had only one small window in the corner overlooking the side street (if you stood on tiptoe). Again, tired and tatty decor, nasty smell from the sink overflow and the cleaning staff don't believe in looking behind doors for dust.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While spending a couple of weeks in the Medoc region we decided to spend a night in Bordeaux and chose the Quality St Catherine Hotel based on user reviews on this website. We had a room about three floors up with a view of the narrow street at the front. The room was fine, although the bathroom was a little tatty. We took breakfast at one of the many nearby cafés as we thought €12,00 each at the hotel was rather steep. The room cost us €86,00 - booked online.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel - Central location
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: There are many restaurants nearby and we chose Le Bistrot d'Edouard in the next square. We paid €74 for a three course meal for two with wine, coffee and liqueurs. Good atmosphere as we ate outside, although they do try to hurry you along. We resisted and they lost interest after 9pm when the crowds were dwindling.

reviews.title: Adequate, not great
reviews.text: We'd stay at the St Catherine again.

reviews.title: Great location and good value
reviews.text: We had the good fortune to stay 1-night at the Quality Hotel St. Catherine (27 rue du Parlement) in June 2006. We selected this hotel based primarily on the great reviews from other people in tripadvisor.com and we could not agree more! The personnel are very friendly and helpful and the location cannot be beat. We booked a wonderful corner room that had two windows so that we could look down at the people walking below. I believe this particular room was larger than most and I would highly recommend asking for a larger-size room. This is by no means a luxury hotel (which we knew), but for what it is, it cannot be beat. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Hotel St. Catherine for one night July 9th. It is a bit tattered. The non smoking rooms were subject to the air system for the entire building which consisted of recycled smokey air. Smoking is permitted in the entrance of the hotel. Breakfast is excellent and in a nice non smoking setting. It is centrally located in the pedestrian zone. It is overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: Air conditioned paradise during a Bordeaux heat wave
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: Great location, friendly staff, rooms clean and bright. We did not have a view from our window, but we were there to see the city not to look out of the window. Ideally situated for everything. We did get off the Jet bus at the wrong place, so if you are using the Jet bus make sure you get off near the Tourist Information offices, not just Centre Ville, from the Tourist Info office it is easy to find the hotel and they will be able to give you a good map and directions. Would definitely use again.

reviews.title: Claustrophobics avoid the windowless rooms!
reviews.text: Arrived the first night to a room with no proper window - just a small knee high one in the corner which didn't open and a skylight way up high. Not good for a claustrophobic like me, the lifts were pretty small as well. Moved to room with a window (5th floor) - this was great with a view over rooftops to the cathedral. AC units in both rooms worked well and were quiet. Showers were v. powerful, bathrooms clean. Breakfast good, staff friendly. Asked them to order us at taxi to the airport on departure - cost 40eu. When we arrived the same journey only cost 26eu so I guess they use an expensive taxi firm. Location was fabulous - in the pedestrianized zone, very near the tourist info. (which was briliiant - the place to book everything, catch buses etc).

We stayed at this hotel over the 2nd May bank holiday. I booked through a website and, on arrival, we were given an executive room rather than standard. The decor was a little old fashioned but clean. It had a large bed, sitting area, TV (BBC & CNN news), reasonable shower. There was no view from the window - just a wall which was perfect for us - my husband has trouble sleeping and this meant the room was very quiet! Besides who wants to spend time in the hotel room? Staff were helpful.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: On reading a Trip Advisor's advice we too ate breakfast at the patisserie opposite the hotel on rue de St Catherine for a third of the price - much better value!
reviews.title: Solid, not for romance
Loved the whole Bordeaux
reviews.text: Our purpose was to shop and eat drink well - fully accomplished! The shopping street is outside the hotel and the main bar/restaurant areas a couple of minutes walk away - these are at the place du parlement, place camille julian & st pierre area.

description: Charming Hotel housed in an 18th-century building, set in the heart of town on one of Europe's largest pedestrian shopping streets
